thread.section_title: The Columbus Dispatch High School Sports Feed
thread.title: High-school athletes of the week

title: High-school athletes of the week
text:
Saturday October 10, 2015 6:27 AM 
The Dispatch high-school Athletes of the Week, based on performances of Sept. 28 to Oct. 4: Izzy Esber GRANDVIEW, GIRLS SOCCER 
Esber, a senior goaltender, set a school record with her 34th career shutout, making six saves in a 2-0 win over Bexley. She also made three saves in a 2-0 win over Worthington Christian and four saves in a 3-1 win over Wellington. Aaron Wood FISHER CATHOLIC, BOYS GOLF 
Wood, a junior, was medalist with a 3-over-par 75 in helping the Irish win the Division III 
sectional tournament at Pine Hill. Wood also topped a field of 262 runners to win the Panther Cross Country Invitational title at Pickerington North. 
Esber and Wood will receive plaques from Motorists Insurance. Coaches are encouraged to email sports@dispatch.com or fax 614-461-8798 by 4 p.m. Mondays with nominations. 
In addition to the two Athletes of the Week, The Dispatch recognizes a top performer in each sport in season: Luke McCarrell CARDINGTON, FOOTBALL 
McCarrell, a junior quarterback, completed 14 of 14 passes for a school-record 422 yards and five touchdowns (four to Devin Pearl) and also ran for a score in a 55-21 win over Northmor. Jack Ostrowski COLUMBUS ACADEMY, BOYS SOCCER 
Ostrowski, typically a center defender, scored all four Vikings goals as a center striker in a 4-1 win over Berlin Hiland. Steven Adams TEAYS VALLEY, BOYS CROSS COUNTRY 
Adams, a senior, topped a field of 237 runners to win the Piketon Invitational in 16 minutes, 6.5 seconds. He won by 20 seconds. Teays Valley won the 23-team meet with 41 points. Audrey Grammel COLUMBUS ACADEMY, GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY 
Grammel, a junior, won the Division III race in the Erin L. Nance Distance Classic at London in 19:59, leading the Vikings to the title with 26 points. Sidney Kadlic OLENTANGY LIBERTY, GIRLS GOLF 
Kadlic, a sophomore, shot 35 with three birdies to win a dual match victory over Watterson and shot 38 for medalist in a tri-match with Pickerington North and Worthington Kilbourne. Both matches were at Scioto Reserve. Kali Apelt HILLIARD DARBY, GIRLS VOLLEYBALL 
Apelt, a junior setter, totaled 34 assists, 17 digs, four kills and two aces in a 3-2 victory over Dublin Jerome and 29 assists, seven digs, six kills and four aces in a 3-1 victory over Canal Winchester. Marissa Madison COLUMBUS SCHOOL FOR GIRLS, TENNIS 
Madison, a junior, won five matches to capture a Division II sectional singles championship, including a 6-0, 6-0 semifinal win over Brenna Homberg of Jonathan Alder and a 6-0, 6-3 win over Unicorns teammate Stephanie Presper in the final. Maddy Vincent BEXLEY, GIRLS FIELD HOCKEY 
Vincent, a freshman, scored two goals in a 4-1 win over Dublin Coffman and scored both goals for the Lions in a 4-2 loss to Ursuline Academy.
